Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been good. I actually started a conversation with someone at the coffee shop!
That’s fantastic! How did it go?
It went really well! We talked about our favorite places to paint.
That’s wonderful to hear! It sounds like you’re becoming more comfortable in social settings.
Yes, I felt really good afterward.
That’s what it’s all about! Have you had any other social interactions since then?
I met a few more people at the painting class, and we’re planning to have a little get-together next week.
That’s amazing! It sounds like you’re building some meaningful connections.
Yes, I’m really excited about it!
That’s great! How do you feel about the idea of getting together with them?
I’m a bit nervous, but mostly excited.
It’s normal to feel a mix of emotions. What do you think you’ll do to prepare for the get-together?
I might think of some topics to talk about in advance.
That’s a smart strategy! Preparing can help ease your nerves. Would you like to brainstorm some conversation starters?
Sure!
How about asking them about their favorite art supplies or techniques?
That’s a good idea!
You could also share what you’ve enjoyed painting recently.
Yes, I can do that.
How do you feel about your progress in social situations overall?
I feel proud of myself. I didn’t think I could do it!
You should be proud! You’re stepping outside of your comfort zone, which is a big accomplishment.
Thank you!
How has your sleep been since we last spoke?
It’s been more consistent. I’m sleeping better, about 80% of the time now.
That’s excellent! What do you think has contributed to that improvement?
I think sticking to my routine and doing mindfulness exercises has really helped.
That’s great to hear! You’re doing an amazing job taking care of yourself.
Thank you!
Is there anything else you’d like to work on today?
I think I’d like to explore some more coping strategies for when I feel lonely.
That’s a great idea. What coping strategies have you tried in the past?
I usually just call someone, but sometimes it doesn’t feel enough.
It’s good that you’re reaching out. Have you thought about engaging in activities that make you feel fulfilled?
I haven’t really tried that. What do you mean?
Activities like volunteering or joining community events can provide a sense of purpose and connection.
That sounds interesting!
Would you be open to looking into local volunteer opportunities?
Yes, I’d like to explore that.
Perfect! Let’s set that as a goal for this week. You can research a few options and see what resonates with you.
I can do that!
Is there anything else on your mind today?
I think that’s everything for now.
Great! I’m proud of the progress you’re making. Let’s check in next week on your experiences and goals.
Thank you, Ellie!
Take care, and I look forward to hearing all about it!
Bye!
Goodbye!
